definition: half of a game or contest/half-court
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams

sentences.english: Our team was in the lead at half time.
The ball he put over at the start of the second half at Hull was like Beckham in his prime.
sentences.chinese: 对赫尔城下半场刚开始他射进的入球像极了贝克汉姆。

sentences.english: Mark Viduka's missed header in the first half.
sentences.chinese: 维杜卡上半场错失的那个头球。

sentences.english: Milan showed compactness, risking very little in the second half.
sentences.chinese: 米兰表现的很简洁，在下半场没有制造什么威胁。

sentences.english: Just like in Hannover we made too many mistakes in the first half.
sentences.chinese: 就像在汉诺威，我们在上半场犯了太多错误。

sentences.english: Wilshere started against Juventus on Saturday and went close with a volley in the first half.
sentences.chinese: 小威在周六与尤文的比赛中首发，上半场有一脚射门。

sentences.english: I knew your team broke through the Shanghai team's half-court pre .
sentences.chinese: 我知道你们球队打破了上海队的半场紧逼。

sentences.english: Obviously, I don't like to play half-court basketball.
sentences.chinese: 很明显，我不喜欢打半场篮球。

sentences.english: Diego Milito with a goal five minutes before half-time.
sentences.chinese: 迭戈米利托在半场结束五分钟前攻入了全场唯一入球。

sentences.english: The game got off to a sluggish start, but after half-time it fairly zipped along.
sentences.chinese: 比赛开始时有些呆滞，可是反半场的节奏却相当轻快。
匪徒们联手在上半场拿到了15分。

sentences.english: Dayton was substituted for Williams in the second half of the match.
sentences.chinese: 下半场比赛由戴顿代替威廉上场。

sentences.english: Two nights later, the Nets surrendered a 72-point first half to the Indiana Pacers.
sentences.chinese: 两天后，篮网半场又让步行者拿了71分。

sentences.english: When Princeton,a ball-control team, of course, was behind 33 to 9 against Penn at halftime.
sentences.chinese: 普林斯顿不善于控球，在半场以9比33落后于对方。

sentences.english: For Sevilla, Renato had scored in the 14th minute of the first half.
sentences.chinese: 塞维利亚由雷纳托在上半场14分钟进球。

sentences.english: England brought on a sub in the second half.
sentences.chinese: 英国队下半场换上了一名替补队员。

definition: to equalize/to level the score/to pull back the advantage
to reverse (the score)/to pull off a comeback/to take the lead
end (of a performance or sports match)/last round of testing in the imperial examinations
(soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
opening (chess etc)/early stage of game, match, work, activity etc
to break the rules/an illegality/a foul
to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
